秦.definition: surname Qin; Qin dynasty (221-207 BC) of the first emperor 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3huang2]; short name for 陝西|陕西[Shan3xi1]

秦二世.definition: Qin Ershi (229-207 BC), second Qin emperor

秦代.definition: Qin dynasty (221-207 BC), founded by the first emperor Qin Shihuang 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2], the first dynasty to rule the whole of China

秦國.definition: the state of Qin, one of the seven states of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)

秦城監獄.definition: Qincheng Prison, maximum-security prison located about 30 km north of central Beijing, whose inmates include former high-level officials convicted of corruption

秦始皇.definition: Qin Shihuang (259-210 BC), the first emperor

秦始皇帝陵.definition: the mausoleum of the First Emperor near Xi'an

秦始皇陵.definition: the tomb of the first emperor at Mt Li 驪山|骊山[Li2 shan1] near Xi'an (awaits excavation)

秦孝公.definition: Duke Xiao of Qin, 秦國|秦国[Qin2 guo2], ruled 361-338 BC during the Warring States Period

秦安.definition: Qin'an county in Tianshui 天水[Tian1 shui3], Gansu

秦安縣.definition: Qin'an county in Tianshui 天水[Tian1 shui3], Gansu

秦嶺.definition: Qinling Mountain Range in Shaanxi forming a natural barrier between the Guanzhong Plain 關中平原|关中平原[Guan1 zhong1 Ping2 yuan2] and the Han River 漢水|汉水[Han4 shui3] valley

秦嶺山脈.definition: Qinling Mountain Range in Shaanxi, forming a natural barrier between the Guanzhong Plain 關中平原|关中平原[Guan1 zhong1 Ping2 yuan2] and the Han River 漢水|汉水[Han4 shui3] valley

秦嶺蜀棧道.definition: the Qinling plank road to Shu, a historical mountain road from Shaanxi to Sichuan

秦州.definition: Qinzhou district of Tianshui city 天水市[Tian1 shui3 shi4], Gansu

秦州區.definition: Qinzhou district of Tianshui city 天水市[Tian1 shui3 shi4], Gansu

秦惠文王.definition: King Huiwen of Qin 秦國|秦国, ruled 338-311 BC during the Warring States Period

秦末.definition: the end of the Qin dynasty 207 BC

秦椒.definition: (dialect) hot pepper (long and thin); same as 花椒[hua1 jiao1]

秦檜.definition: Qin Hui (1090-1155 AD), Song Dynasty official said to have betrayed General Yue Fei 岳飛|岳飞[Yue4 Fei1]

秦淮.definition: Qinhuai district of Nanjing City 南京市 in Jiangsu 江蘇|江苏

秦淮八艷.definition: the famous eight beautiful and talented courtesans who lived near the Qinhuai River 秦淮河[Qin2 huai2 He2] in the late Ming or early Qing

秦淮區.definition: Qinhuai district of Nanjing City 南京市 in Jiangsu 江蘇|江苏

秦淮河.definition: Qinhuai River, a tributary of the Yangtze that flows through central Nanjing

秦漢.definition: the Qin (221-207 BC) and Han (206 BC-220 AD) dynasties

秦火.definition: the Qin burning of the books in 212 BC

秦牧.definition: Qin Mu (1919-1992), educator and prolific writer

秦皇島.definition: see 秦皇島市|秦皇岛市[Qin2huang2dao3 Shi4]

秦皇島市.definition: Qinhuangdao, prefecture-level city in Hebei Province 河北省[He2bei3 Sheng3]

秦穆公.definition: Duke Mu of Qin, the first substantial king of Qin (ruled 659-621 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸

秦篆.definition: seal script as unified by the Qin dynasty; the small seal 小篆 and great seal 大篆

秦腔.definition: Qinqiang, an opera style popular in northwest China, possibly originating in Ming dynasty folk music; Shaanxi opera

秦越人.definition: Qin Yueren (407-310 BC), Warring States physician known for his medical skills

秦軍.definition: the Qin army (model for the terracotta warriors)

秦都.definition: Qindu District in Xianyang City 咸陽市|咸阳市[Xian2 yang2 Shi4], Shaanxi

秦都區.definition: Qindu District in Xianyang City 咸陽市|咸阳市[Xian2 yang2 Shi4], Shaanxi

秦鏡高懸.definition: see 明鏡高懸|明镜高悬[ming2 jing4 gao1 xuan2]

秦陵.definition: the tomb of the First Emperor at Mt Li 驪山|骊山[Li2 shan1] near Xi'an (awaits excavation)

秦韜玉.definition: Qin Taoyu, Tang poet, author of the poem "A Poor Woman" 貧女|贫女[Pin2nu:3]
